body: That's a good idea! I like it because it makes for an unambiguous way to write a single-element tuple type; whenever I see `tuple[int]` I feel like the author may well have meant `tuple[int, ...]`.

issue.title: Avoid magic-trailing-comma in single-element subscripts
issue.body:
### Description

Closes #2918. Ignores magic-trailing-comma for single-element subscripts.

### Checklist - did you ...

<!-- If any of the following items aren't relevant for your contribution
     please still tick them so we know you've gone through the checklist.

    All user-facing changes should get an entry. Otherwise, signal to us
    this should get the magical label to silence the CHANGELOG entry check.
    Tests are required for bugfixes and new features. Documentation changes
    are necessary for formatting and most enhancement changes. -->

- [X] Add a CHANGELOG entry if necessary?
- [X] Add / update tests if necessary?

issue.title: Add custom rewrites, using e.g. `libcst`

repository.name: shed
repository.description: `shed` canonicalises Python code.  Shed your legacy, stop bikeshedding, and move on.  Black++

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
- [x] Split up `assert a and b` into two separate assertions, for easier debugging.  Preserve comments.
- [x] Break heavily-annotated function arguments over multiple lines, like https://github.com/Zac-HD/shed/issues/22#issuecomment-1073072395 - this should be in a separate PR so I can evaluate the heuristic on some real large code corpora
- [x] [NoRedundantLambdaRule](https://fixit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/rules/NoRedundantLambdaRule.html) ([impl](https://github.com/Instagram/Fixit/blob/f2e5c080cde2febff194f3a29074d51a29667d10/fixit/rules/no_redundant_lambda.py)): "de-proxy" patterns like `lambda x: whatever(x)` to just `whatever`.
  - [x] special case for literals: [pie807: prefer list builtin](https://github.com/sbdchd/flake8-pie#pie807-prefer-list-builtin) on `[]`, plus `{}`, `()`.
- [ ] [pie801: prefer simple return](https://github.com/sbdchd/flake8-pie#pie801-prefer-simple-return)
- [x] In `sorted(list(...))`, remove the inner call to `list()` (etc; see [flake8-comprehensions](https://pypi.org/project/flake8-comprehensions/) for more)
  - [ ] likewise in `"...".join(list(...))`, remove the call to `list()` (or `tuple()`)
  - [ ] ... and similarly in `all()`, `dict()`, `sum()`, `min()`, and `max()`
- [x] [pie787: no len condition](https://github.com/sbdchd/flake8-pie#pie787-no-len-condition)
- [x] [pie788: no bool condition](https://github.com/sbdchd/flake8-pie#pie788-no-bool-condition)
- [x] `raise NotImplemented` should be `raise NotImplementedError`
- [x] Remove redundant parens directly around a function call, or around the argument to a function
- [x] Replace `assert False` with `raise AssertionError`, handling the optional arg
- [x] Reorder `Union` and `Literal` contents so that `None` is last
- [x] Flatten syntatically nested `Union` or `Literal` instances
- [x] Reorder new-style unions using `|` so that None is last
- [x] [Expand `convert_none_cmp()`](https://github.com/Zac-HD/shed/blob/044b201972925ac627ba1e8193cb387862501546/src/shed/_codemods.py#L140-L143) to handle `True` and `False` too, *ala* [CompareSingletonPrimitivesByIsRule](https://fixit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/rules/CompareSingletonPrimitivesByIsRule.html)
- [x] Replace builtin calls with literals: we do this for comprehensions, but should also do e.g. `tuple()`->`()`, `list("")`->`[]`, etc.
- [ ] Remove `list()` (or tuple) call in comprehensions such as `[x**2 for x in list(...)]` - we're about to iterate anyway.  Only applies to list, set, or dict comprehensions; generator expressions might not consume the whole iterable.
- [ ] Replace `map(lambda ..., x)` with a comprehension, like https://github.com/adamchainz/flake8-comprehensions/pull/409
  - [ ] And likewise rewrite `filter(lambda ..., x)`
- [ ] Nontrivial cases of [CollapseIsinstanceChecksRule](https://fixit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/rules/CollapseIsinstanceChecksRule.html) ([impl](https://github.com/Instagram/Fixit/blob/f2e5c080cde2febff194f3a29074d51a29667d10/fixit/rules/chained_instance_check.py)): `isinstance(x, y) or isinstance(x, z)` -> `isinstance(x, (y, z))`
- [ ] If the last `except ...:` clause just does `raise`, remove it and repeat for the preceeding clause.  If it's the only except clause and there's no `finally:`, remove the `try:` block entirely.
- [ ] [pie797: no unnecessary ternary](https://github.com/sbdchd/flake8-pie#pie797-no-unnecessary-if-expr)
- [ ] [pie800: no unnecessary spread](https://github.com/sbdchd/flake8-pie#pie800-no-unnecessary-spread)
- [ ] [pie804: no unnecessary dict kwargs](https://github.com/sbdchd/flake8-pie#pie804-no-unnecessary-dict-kwargs)
- [ ] Replace `sorted(...)[0]` with `min(...)` (or `[-1]` with `max(...)`).  Invert min/max if passed `reverse=True` (or truthy constant); ignore `reverse=False` (or falsey); skip if the `reverse=` argument is present with any non-constant value.

Variously inspired by linters (`flake8`, `flake8-comprehensions`, `fixit`, etc.) and my own observations of some typed code.

issue.title: Add magic-trailing-comma newline to function definition and call.

labels.name: R: invalid
labels.description: This issue / pull request doesn't seem right

issue.body:
The latest release, [22.3.0](https://github.com/psf/black/releases/tag/22.3.0), issue #2918, PR #2942, has broken formatting for function definition and call. In previous versions of Black the following: 

```python
def intentional_comma(a: int, b: int, c: int,) -> int:
    return a + b + c

def intentional_comma(a: int, b: int, c: int,):
    return a + b + c

intentional_comma(a=10, b=20, c=30,)
```

Would be formatted to:

```python
def intentional_comma(
    a: int, 
    b: int, 
    c: int,
) -> int:
    return a + b + c

def intentional_comma(
    a: int, 
    b: int, 
    c: int,
):
    return a + b + c

intentional_comma(
    a=10, 
    b=20, 
    c=30,
)
```

But the new versioning breaks this, and the above is now formatted as:

```python
def intentional_comma(a: int, b: int, c: int,) -> int:
    return a + b + c

def intentional_comma(
    a: int, b: int, c: int,
):
    return a + b + c

intentional_comma(
    a=10, b=20, c=30,
)
```

issue.title: Black 23.1 no longer respects trailing magic comma for single length list

labels.name: T: style
labels.description: What do we want Blackened code to look like?

labels.name: R: not a bug
labels.description: This is deliberate behavior of Black.

issue.body:
```python
from typing import Literal

A = Literal[
    "DEFAULT",
]
```

```bash
 black magic.py --check
would reformat magic.py

Oh no!   
1 file would be reformatted.
```
It turns it into:
```python
from typing import Literal

A = Literal["DEFAULT",]

```

I personally would prefer to respect trailing magic commas here, but at the very least remove the trailing comma if is going to be inlined into a single line.

body: While this makes sense for tuples I don't think we can make the same case for Literals  guess there's no good choice here...
